nodes.title: PlayStation platform
nodes.short_description: Sony’s flagship gaming ecosystem driving hardware, software, and subscription revenues.

nodes.title: Microsoft
nodes.short_description: Rival Xbox platform and game services compete directly; strategic moves shape Sony’s gaming market.

nodes.title: Call of Duty
nodes.short_description: Top-selling franchise influencing console choice, engagement, and PlayStation revenues.

nodes.title: United States
nodes.short_description: Key market for games, music, and films; regulatory and consumer trends drive performance.

nodes.title: CMOS Image Sensors
nodes.short_description: Core component business supplying smartphone and camera markets; volume and pricing drive profits.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Large smartphone and entertainment market; regulations and demand swings impact sensors and content.

nodes.title: U.S. sanctions on Huawei
nodes.short_description: Export restrictions curtailed Huawei smartphone production, reducing Sony’s image sensor shipments.

nodes.title: Huawei
nodes.short_description: Smartphone demand shifts and restrictions materially impact Sony’s image sensor sales.

nodes.title: Nintendo
nodes.short_description: Competing consoles and first-party exclusives affect Sony’s market share and pricing.

nodes.title: Samsung Electronics
nodes.short_description: Major smartphone maker and image-sensor competitor, shaping demand and pricing dynamics.

nodes.title: TSMC
nodes.short_description: Manufacturing partner for Japan fab projects; capacity and process nodes affect Sony’s chip supply.

nodes.title: The Walt Disney Company
nodes.short_description: Marvel partnership and Spider-Man film rights materially affect Sony Pictures revenues.

nodes.title: Japan
nodes.short_description: Headquarters, workforce, and policy environment influence strategy, currency, and operations.
